subSubSection.paragraph:

Remarks. Paramere length varies slightly even within the same population. The weak differences in paramere length in the holotypes of
M . lignicolor
und
S. tenebrosa
must be considered infraspecific variation. Comparison of paramere shape between the lectotypes of
Autoserica laboriosa
and
Serica tenebrosa
revealed that they are virtually identical.
Kim & Lee ( 1997 )
treated this taxon as
Maladera fusiana
based on the aedeagus drawings of
Murayama ( 1954 )
. Based on these figures (which were very roughly done)
Maladera fusiana
should be considered as a synonym of
M. lignicolor
. The slight differences in paramere shape shown in Murayama’s ( 1954 : 39 , Fig. 49 ) drawings might be attributed to poor drawing technique, or perhaps he used a slightly aberrant or immature specimen (with deformed parameres) for that figure.
